properties.title: JMeter Dashboard/ Report Codebase Intellectual Property (IP) Clearance Status

section.title: JMeter Dashboard/ Report Codebase Intellectual Property (IP) Clearance Status
Description
section.p: JMeter Dashboard/ Report is a new set of classes, HTML, Javascript, CSS and freemarker pages that allow generation of a report for a Load Test at end of Load Test or on an existing CSV result file. It generates a standalone HTML page with dynamic graphs and tables to show response times, APDEX,

ul.li: Which PMC will be responsible for the code : Apache JMeter PMC
Into which existing project/module: Apache JMeter
Officer or member managing donation: Bruno Demion (milamber)

p.em: Completed tasks are shown by the completion date (YYYY-MM-dd).

section.title: Identify the codebase
section.p: MD5 or SHA1 sum for donated software: (Note versioned software used to calculate sum in parentheses).

section.title: Copyright

tr.td: Check and make sure that the papers that transfer rights to the ASF been received. It is only necessary to transfer rights for the package, the core code, and any new code produced by the project.
Check and make sure that the files that have been donated have been updated to reflect the new ASF copyright.

section.p: Identify name recorded for software grant: the name of the grant as recorded in the foundation/officers area, in either grants.txt or cclas.txt, so that the grant can be easily identified. If recorded in the grants.txt document, use the "for" or title. If recorded in the cclas.txt document, use the company name (field 2 without submitter name) and the "form on file" name (field 4, without any people's names).

section.title: Verify distribution rights
section.p: Corporations and individuals holding existing distribution rights:

tr.td: Ubik-Ingenierie S.A.S. has signed an initial CCLA. Acknowledged on 30th june 2013. As this CCLA did not contain a Schedule B, they sent a new one on 25th November mentioning this partial sponsoring of the donation and its full development.
Decathlon S.A. has signed CCLA containing a Schedule B mentioning their partial sponsoring of this donation.
All contribution dependencies conform to Apache or Apache compatible license.

section.p: Generally, the result of checking off these items will be a Software Grant, CLA, and Corporate CLA for ASF licensed code, which must have no dependencies upon items whose licenses that are incompatible with the Apache License.

section.title: Organizational acceptance of responsibility for the project

li.em: The VOTE thread accepting the donation can be found on dev@jmeter.apache.org or:
